metadata.purpose: Verified alarm-specific fix procedures with source attribution
metadata.safety_note: All procedures derived from manufacturer documentation or authorized service sources

verification_levels.COMMUNITY_VALIDATED: Multiple forum confirmations with technical accuracy

SERVO.description: The n-th axis (axis 1-8) overload signal is on. Refer to diagnostic display No. 201, 720 or 721 for details.

immediate_actions: 2. Do NOT reset immediately - investigate cause first
3. Record alarm axis number and conditions
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for mechanical binding or excessive load on the n-th axis
2. Inspect servo motor and connections for damage or loose connections
3. Verify axis parameters are correctly set for the application
4. Check diagnostic display No. 201, 720, or 721 for overload signal details
resolution_steps: 1. If mechanical binding: resolve binding issue, check lubrication
2. If parameter issue: adjust servo parameters within allowable limits
3. If persistent: power off CNC machine, wait a few minutes, power back on
4. If unresolved: contact qualified FANUC service technician
verification: 1. Jog axis slowly in both directions
2. Run test program at reduced feed rate

SERVO.safety_warning: Do not attempt repairs unless qualified. Contact authorized service for persistent issues.

SERVO.alarm_name: SERVO ALARM: n-TH AXIS VRDY OFF
SERVO.description: The n-th axis (axis 1-8) servo amplifier READY signal (DRDY) went off.

immediate_actions: 1. Note which axis triggered the alarm
2. Check servo amplifier LED display for alarm code
diagnostic_steps: 2. Verify power supply to servo amplifier
3. Check cable connections between CNC and servo amp
4. Review diagnostic display for additional details
resolution_steps: 1. If power issue: verify input power to servo system
2. If cable issue: check and reseat all connections
3. If amp fault: address specific amp alarm code
4. If persistent: servo amplifier may need repair or replacement
verification: 1. Power cycle and verify DRDY signal comes on

SERVO.safety_warning: Servo amplifier contains high voltage. Do not open covers without proper training.

SERVO.alarm_name: SERVO ALARM: n-TH AXIS VRDY ON
SERVO.description: Even though the n-th axis (axis 1-8) READY signal (MCON) went off, the servo amplifier READY signal (DRDY) is still on. Or, when the power was turned on, DRDY went on even though MCON was off.

immediate_actions: 2. Check servo interface module and servo amp connections
diagnostic_steps: 1. Verify cable connections between CNC and servo amplifier
resolution_steps: 2. Check for damaged cables or connectors
3. If persistent: servo interface or amp may be faulty

SERVO.alarm_name: SERVO ALARM: n-TH AXIS - EXCESS ERROR (STOPPED)
SERVO.description: The position deviation value when the n-th axis (axis 1-8) stops is larger than the set value.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for mechanical binding or obstruction
resolution_steps: 1. If mechanical: resolve binding, check lubrication
2. If encoder: check cable, may need replacement
3. If parameter: adjust position error limit if appropriate
4. If servo gain: tune servo parameters
verification: 1. Jog axis and verify position tracking
2. Run program and monitor position deviation

SERVO.alarm_name: SERVO ALARM: n-TH AXIS - EXCESS ERROR (MOVING)
SERVO.description: The position deviation value when the n-th axis (axis 1-8) moves is larger than the set value.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check mechanical system for binding or excessive friction
2. Verify servo motor and encoder function
3. Check for improper feedrate or acceleration settings
resolution_steps: 1. Reduce rapid traverse rate or cutting feedrate
2. Check and adjust servo gains if needed
3. Verify mechanical system is properly lubricated
4. Check for worn ballscrew or guides
verification: 1. Run test program at reduced feed

SERVO.description: Position detection system fault in the n-th axis pulse coder (disconnection alarm). Refer to diagnosis display No. 201 for details.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check diagnostic display No. 201 for specific error
2. Inspect encoder cable for damage or loose connections
3. Check encoder connector at motor and amplifier ends
resolution_steps: 3. If cable OK: encoder may need replacement
4. Contact service if encoder replacement needed
verification: 1. Power cycle and check for alarm clear
2. Jog axis and verify position feedback

SERVO.safety_warning: Encoder cables carry sensitive signals. Handle with care.

immediate_actions: 2. Allow motor to cool - do NOT continue operation
diagnostic_steps: 2. Verify motor cooling fan is operating (if equipped)
3. Check for mechanical binding causing excessive load
4. Review recent operation conditions (heavy cuts, rapid moves)
resolution_steps: 1. Allow motor to cool completely before restart
2. Improve ventilation if ambient temp is high
4. Check motor thermal sensor if false alarm suspected
verification: 2. Run lighter cuts initially after restart

SERVO.safety_warning: Hot motor surfaces can cause burns. Allow cooling before touching.

SERVO.description: The digital servo software detected the soft thermal state (OVC).

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for sustained high current operation
2. Verify motor sizing is appropriate for application
3. Check for mechanical issues causing high torque demand
resolution_steps: 4. If persistent: motor may be undersized for application
verification: 2. Run program with reduced loads initially

SERVO.description: SVM/SVU: The motor current is too high.

immediate_actions: 2. Do not attempt to restart without investigation
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check servo amplifier LED for specific fault code
3. Check for ground fault in motor or cables
resolution_steps: 1. If motor short: motor may need replacement
2. If cable issue: repair or replace motor cable
3. If amplifier fault: may need amp repair/replacement
4. Contact qualified service for motor/amp issues

SERVO.safety_warning: High current faults can indicate serious electrical problems. Do not bypass.

immediate_actions: 2. Do NOT restart until motor cools
3. Check for smoke or burning smell
verification: 1. Run spindle at low RPM first

SPINDLE.safety_warning: Hot surfaces can cause burns. Allow cooling before inspection.

SPINDLE.description: The motor rotates at a speed exceeding 115% of the maximum allowable speed.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check spindle speed command in program
resolution_steps: 2. Verify max speed parameter matches motor specs
4. If sensor issue: may need service
verification: 1. Run spindle at low speed first

SPINDLE.description: Temperature of the heat sink of the SPM main circuit has risen to the set value.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check cooling fan operation on amplifier
2. Verify air flow to amplifier cabinet
resolution_steps: 2. Repair/replace cooling fan if not operating
verification: 1. Monitor heat sink temperature during operation

SPINDLE.description: PSM detected that the DC link voltage was excessively high.

resolution_steps: 1. If power issue: verify input voltage is within spec
2. If regen issue: may need regenerative resistor service
verification: 1. Monitor DC link voltage after restart

SPINDLE.safety_warning: DC link contains high voltage. Do not open covers.

SPINDLE.description: An excessive load has been applied continuously for a certain period.

diagnostic_steps: 2. Check for mechanical binding in spindle
3. Verify tool condition (dull tool increases load)
resolution_steps: 3. Check spindle bearings if mechanical issue suspected
4. Allow recovery time between heavy cuts

SPINDLE.description: The motor failed to rotate as specified, and has stopped or is rotating at a very low speed.

diagnostic_steps: 2. Verify drive belts are not broken/slipping
resolution_steps: 3. If electrical: check motor and amplifier
verification: 1. Manually verify spindle can rotate (with power off)
2. Run spindle at low speed first

SPINDLE.safety_warning: Do not manually rotate spindle with power on.

SPINDLE.description: The PSM detected that the DC link voltage was excessively low.

diagnostic_steps: 2. Check for power sags or brownouts
resolution_steps: 1. If power issue: address facility power quality
2. If PSM fault: may need service/replacement
4. Verify transformer tap settings if applicable

SPINDLE.description: Generated when the spindle control unit is not ready for starting correctly when the power is turned on.

immediate_actions: 1. Power off CNC and spindle amplifier
diagnostic_steps: 1. Verify optical cable is properly connected
2. Check spindle amplifier power is ON
3. Check spindle amp LED for alarm codes
resolution_steps: 2. If spindle amp has alarm: address that alarm first
3. Power cycle spindle amp then CNC
4. If second spindle: check SP2 parameter
verification: 1. Power up system and verify link established

SPINDLE.description: An alarm is generated in the spindle unit. XX is the alarm number shown on the spindle amplifier.

immediate_actions: 1. Note the XX alarm code displayed
diagnostic_steps: 1. Look up the specific AL-XX code in spindle amp alarm list
2. The NC displays the spindle amp's internal alarm
3. Address the specific spindle amplifier alarm
resolution_steps: 1. Resolve the specific spindle amplifier alarm
2. Refer to spindle amplifier alarm troubleshooting

SERVO.description: Indicates that the servo motors are off, the tool changer is disabled, the coolant pump is off, and the spindle motor is stopped. Caused by Emergency Stop, motor fault, or power failure.

resolution_steps: 2. Press RESET to power servos on

SERVO.note: This alarm also appears at startup as informative alarm

SERVO.description: Load on X-axis Servomotor has exceeded parameter 9 X-axis Max Error. Servos are turned off.

immediate_actions: 1. Note axis position when alarm occurred
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for mechanical binding on X-axis
2. Inspect ballscrew and guides for damage
resolution_steps: 3. Verify machine parameters match screw pitch
4. Press RESET to clear alarm and turn on servos
verification: 1. Jog X-axis slowly in both directions

SERVO.description: Load on Y-axis Servomotor has exceeded parameter limit. Servos are turned off.

immediate_actions: 1. Note axis position when alarm occurred
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for mechanical binding on Y-axis
2. Inspect ballscrew and guides for damage
resolution_steps: 3. Press RESET to clear alarm and turn on servos
verification: 1. Jog Y-axis slowly in both directions

SERVO.description: Load on Z-axis Servomotor has exceeded parameter limit. Servos are turned off.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for mechanical binding on Z-axis
resolution_steps: 3. Press RESET to clear alarm and turn on servos
verification: 1. Jog Z-axis slowly in both directions

SERVO.safety_warning: Z-axis may drop if counterbalance fails. Use caution.

SERVO.description: X-axis servo motor is overloaded - cannot maintain required torque or load.
Current in X servo motor beyond limit. Possibly caused by stalled or overloaded motor. Can be caused by running axis into mechanical stop, short in motor, or motor lead grounded.

immediate_actions: 2. Do not attempt to move axis
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check if axis hit mechanical stop
3. Check for coolant contamination at connectors
4. Measure motor resistance leg-to-leg and leg-to-ground
resolution_steps: 1. If mechanical stop: jog away carefully
4. If motor short: motor replacement required
verification: 2. Jog axis slowly to verify operation

SERVO.safety_warning: High current indicates potential electrical fault. Verify motor resistance before restart.

SERVO.description: Current in Y servo motor beyond limit. Possibly caused by stalled or overloaded motor.

immediate_actions: 2. Do not attempt to move axis
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check if axis hit mechanical stop
resolution_steps: 1. If mechanical stop: jog away carefully
3. If motor short: motor replacement required
verification: 2. Jog axis slowly to verify operation

SERVO.description: Current in Z servo motor beyond limit. Possibly caused by stalled or overloaded motor.

verification: 2. Jog axis slowly to verify operation

SERVO.safety_warning: Z-axis drive fault may indicate crash. Inspect carefully.

SPINDLE.description: DC bus voltage too high. Can be caused by regen issues or input voltage problems.

diagnostic_steps: 4. Check DC bus voltage on diagnostics
resolution_steps: 1. If input voltage high: adjust transformer taps
2. If regen issue: check regen resistor
verification: 1. Monitor DC bus voltage during operation
2. Check second page of diagnostics display

SPINDLE.description: Regenerative resistor overheated, typically from high spindle start/stop duty cycle.

diagnostic_steps: 4. Verify input voltage (high voltage causes more regen)
resolution_steps: 4. If persistent: regen resistor may need service
verification: 2. Reduce duty cycle if alarm recurs

SPINDLE.description: Failure of spindle drive, motor or regen load. Can be caused by shorted motor, overvoltage, overcurrent, undervoltage, or failure of drive.

resolution_steps: 2. If motor short: motor may need replacement
3. If regen fault: check regen resistor
4. Contact Haas service for drive replacement
verification: 2. Run spindle at low RPM first

SPINDLE.safety_warning: Vector drive contains high voltage. Follow LOTO procedures.

SPINDLE.description: DC bus voltage too low. Can indicate power supply or incoming power issues.

diagnostic_steps: 4. Check DC bus voltage on diagnostics
resolution_steps: 1. If facility power issue: address with electrician

SYSTEM.alarm_name: COMM. FAILURE WITH MOCON/MOCON MEMORY FAULT
SYSTEM.description: During self-test of communications between MOCON and main processor, the main processor does not respond. May also be caused by memory fault on MOCON.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check ADDRESS and DATA bus cables
resolution_steps: 1. Re-seat ADDRESS and DATA bus cables
3. If persistent: board may be faulty
4. Contact Haas service for board replacement
verification: 1. Power up and verify no alarm

SYSTEM.description: Emergency stop has been activated.

resolution_steps: 1. Address the condition that caused E-Stop

SYSTEM.description: Pneumatic air pressure below minimum required level.

resolution_steps: 1. Verify shop air supply is adequate

SYSTEM.description: Way lube system low on lubricant or pressure below required level.

resolution_steps: 1. Refill lube reservoir with correct oil

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Do not run machine without lubrication - can damage ways and ballscrews.

SYSTEM.description: Memory batteries need replacing within 30 days. The 3.3V Lithium battery is below 2.5 volts.

immediate_actions: 1. Back up all programs and parameters
resolution_steps: 3. Do not delay - loss of memory within 30 days
verification: 1. Verify alarm clears after battery replacement

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Replace battery promptly to avoid loss of programs and parameters.

ATC.alarm_name: SHUTTLE IN FAULT (Mill) / TURRET UNLOCK FAULT (Lathe)
ATC.description: Tool changer shuttle failed to reach in position, or turret failed to unlock.
Tool turret failed to rotate to commanded position.
Spindle failed to orient to correct position for tool change.

resolution_steps: 1. If sensor issue: adjust or replace

NCK_SYSTEM.description: The PLC must give a sign of life within a defined time, or the alarm is triggered.

diagnostic_steps: 3. Check communication between NCK and PLC
resolution_steps: 2. If communication error: check bus connections
3. Verify PLC program is loaded correctly
4. May need to reload PLC program
verification: 1. Verify PLC returns to RUN state
2. Clear alarm and verify no recurrence

NCK_SYSTEM.description: The undervoltage monitor of the NCK battery has reached the prewarning threshold.

immediate_actions: 1. Back up all NC data immediately

NCK_SYSTEM.safety_warning: Replace battery promptly to avoid data loss.

NCK_SYSTEM.description: The undervoltage monitoring of the NCK battery has responded during cyclic operation.

immediate_actions: 1. URGENT: Back up all NC data immediately
2. Do not power off until battery replaced

NCK_SYSTEM.safety_warning: CRITICAL: Data loss imminent. Replace battery immediately.

NCK_SYSTEM.description: The temperature sensor has reached the response threshold.
The fan speed monitoring at the NC module has responded.

immediate_actions: 1. Check if fan is visibly rotating
resolution_steps: 3. Siemens fan/battery module is replaceable unit
verification: 1. Verify fan operates at correct speed

NCK_SYSTEM.safety_warning: NCU will auto-shutdown if overheated. Replace fan promptly.

NCK_SYSTEM.description: The EMERGENCY STOP request is applied to the NCK/PLC interface DB10 DBX56.1.

SINAMICS_DRIVE.description: An internal software error has occurred in SINAMICS.

resolution_steps: 1. Carry out POWER ON (power off/on) for all components
2. If required, check memory card data
4. If persistent: contact Siemens hotline or replace Control Unit

SINAMICS_DRIVE.alarm_name: POWER ON for DRIVE-CLiQ component required
SINAMICS_DRIVE.description: A DRIVE-CLiQ component requires power cycling.

resolution_steps: 1. Switch off power to the specified component
4. For SINUMERIK: POWER ON all components and restart commissioning

SINAMICS_DRIVE.description: Control Unit temperature has exceeded threshold.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check air intake for Control Unit

SINAMICS_DRIVE.description: A download to the drive was interrupted.

resolution_steps: 3. Or boot from previously saved files (p0976)
4. When loading from memory card, use matching version

SINAMICS_DRIVE.alarm_name: CU: Fan operating time reached or exceeded
SINAMICS_DRIVE.description: The Control Unit fan has reached its service life limit.

CYCLE.description: A canned cycle was called without an active tool offset.

immediate_actions: 2. Review program for missing tool call
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for T-word and D-word in program
3. Check active tool in status display

CYCLE.description: Thread pitch parameter is incorrect or missing in threading cycle.
A canned cycle was called without a feed rate programmed.

COMMUNICATION.description: An error occurred during the startup of the PROFIBUS/PROFINET master.
An operating error occurred on the PROFIBUS/PROFINET in cyclic mode.

ALARM_P.description: A bus error has occurred in the CPU. NC functions are inoperative.

immediate_actions: 2. Do not attempt to continue operation

ALARM_P.safety_warning: Alarm P shuts off axis drive power. System inoperative until resolved.

ALARM_P.description: Error occurred during NC system startup.

resolution_steps: 2. If alarm persists: may need software reload

ALARM_A.description: Follow-up error in axis movement exceeds the permissible error range (position deviation too large).

resolution_steps: 3. If encoder: check connections, may need replacement
4. If drive unit: contact Okuma service
verification: 1. Reset alarm and jog axis slowly
2. Verify smooth motion in both directions

ALARM_A.description: A problem has developed in the safety IO link, often caused by shorted solenoid or contaminated switch.

immediate_actions: 1. Note the specific code following the alarm
diagnostic_steps: 1. The code after alarm points to input/output location
2. Check for coolant contamination at switches
resolution_steps: 3. Replace damaged IO board if necessary
verification: 1. Clear alarm and verify system operation

SYSTEM.description: Battery backup capacity reduced or battery error detected.

immediate_actions: 1. Back up all programs and parameters immediately

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Replace battery promptly to avoid data loss.

SYSTEM.alarm_name: CPU FAN OR POWER SUPPLY FAN ALARM
SYSTEM.description: CPU fan or power supply fan is not operating at specified threshold speed.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check if fans are plugged in correctly
resolution_steps: 3. Replace fan if rotating slowly or stopped
4. If fans OK: inspect panel computer
verification: 1. Verify fan operates at correct speed

SYSTEM.description: Issue with inverter - defective control board, motor over current, voltage issue, or shorted motor.

resolution_steps: 2. If voltage issue: check power supply
3. If inverter fault: may need drive replacement

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Faulty motor can damage drive unit. Verify motor before restart.

SYSTEM.description: OSP control sees a discrepancy in the serial link of the MCS system during control boot-up.

immediate_actions: 2. Check for recent changes to system
diagnostic_steps: 4. Look for miswiring in MCS serial link
resolution_steps: 2. Verify ID address settings are correct
verification: 1. Power cycle and verify clean boot

SYSTEM.description: Supplied voltage is abnormally high or low for proper operation.

diagnostic_steps: 4. Check KVA rating vs machine requirements
resolution_steps: 1. Ensure power supply matches machine KVA rating

SYSTEM.description: Memory board battery is depleted and needs replacement.

immediate_actions: 1. Back up all programs and parameters immediately
2. Do not power off until backup complete
verification: 2. Power cycle and verify all data intact

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Replace battery with power ON to prevent data loss.

SYSTEM.description: Error occurred reading or transferring servo link data file, or data file contains abnormal data.

resolution_steps: 3. If persistent: may need software reload
4. Contact Okuma service for data file issues
verification: 2. Test all axes for proper operation

SYSTEM.description: Warning messages that do not stop NC operation but indicate conditions requiring attention.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Refer to alarm list for specific code meaning

SYSTEM_DRIVE.description: The emergency stop button on the operation panel has been pressed.
SYSTEM_DRIVE.source: Mazak MAZATROL FUSION 640M Alarm List H735SA0027E

resolution_steps: 2. Reset NC system to initial state

SYSTEM_DRIVE.description: Hardware emergency stop - turn power off and back on.

resolution_steps: 4. If alarm persists: contact Mazak service

SYSTEM_DRIVE.description: Contents of system software and/or custom software have been destroyed.

diagnostic_steps: 1. This is a critical system error
resolution_steps: 2. System software reload may be required
verification: 1. Full system test after software reload

SYSTEM_DRIVE.safety_warning: Do not operate machine until software verified by Mazak service.

SYSTEM_DRIVE.description: The S-RAM mounted on the CPU card has become abnormal.
Absolute position detection system has lost absolute position data.

verification: 1. Verify all axes at correct position

SYSTEM_DRIVE.safety_warning: Verify machine zero position before resuming operation.

NC_CONTROL.description: Incorrect mode selection or mode selector switch malfunction.

resolution_steps: 2. If switch malfunction: contact Mazak service

NC_CONTROL.description: The cutting-feed override value is set to 0 on the machine operating panel.

diagnostic_steps: 2. If not 0: check signal line for short
resolution_steps: 1. Change cutting-feed override to value greater than 0
2. If signal line short: repair wiring
verification: 1. Verify feed operates at set override

NC_CONTROL.description: Spindle rotation did not start when spindle rotation command was issued.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check spindle amplifier for normal operation
resolution_steps: 1. If amplifier fault: may need service
3. Contact Mazak Technical Center if unresolved
verification: 1. Test spindle at low RPM first

NC_CONTROL.description: The spindle speed limit has been exceeded.

resolution_steps: 2. If amplifier fault: contact Mazak service

PLC.description: Hydraulic pressure is low, detected by compound oil controller unit.
Slideway lubricating oil level is low, detected by sensor SL4.

diagnostic_steps: 2. Check for leaks in lube lines
resolution_steps: 1. Refill lubricant reservoir with correct oil

PLC.safety_warning: Do not operate without lubrication - can damage ways and ballscrews.

PLC.description: Main transformer temperature has exceeded 120C, detected by sensor X10.

resolution_steps: 3. Reduce machine duty cycle if needed
4. Check for short circuits causing overload

PLC.safety_warning: Hot transformer can cause fire. Allow cooling before service.

PLC.description: Tool breakage detected during tool breakage detection cycle.

immediate_actions: 2. Do not resume until tool checked

NC_ERRORS.description: Program run is interrupted by the TNC (INTERNER STOP). Severe error requiring attention.

immediate_actions: 3. Open HELP window for associated text
diagnostic_steps: 1. Press ERR key to display error list
2. Review error class (ERROR causes program stop)
3. Check if error persists after CE key
resolution_steps: 1. If error can be acknowledged: press CE key
2. If error persists after CE: correct underlying cause
3. If severe error (cannot confirm with CE): press END key
4. If END key fails: switch off power, wait several seconds, switch on again

NC_ERRORS.description: PLC error detected. Logged in system with line number reference to PLC error text file.

immediate_actions: 1. Note PLC error message and line number
diagnostic_steps: 2. Check LOG function for error history
3. Reference PLC error text file for details
resolution_steps: 1. Address cause indicated by PLC error
2. Contact machine manufacturer for PLC-specific issues

NC_ERRORS.description: Control was switched off by a POWERFAIL. File system test may be required.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Control performs file system test after improper shutdown
2. Check LOG entries for power fail records
resolution_steps: 3. Allow file system check to complete
4. If power issues frequent: check electrical installation

SYSTEM.description: Control-is-ready output check failed during power-on. If functional error detected, control switches output off.

resolution_steps: 3. Contact machine manufacturer if issue persists

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Control-is-ready output must trigger emergency stop if failed.

SYSTEM.description: Control requires system restart. May be due to configuration change or severe error.

resolution_steps: 1. Press END key to initiate restart
2. If END key fails: switch off power switch
3. Wait several seconds before switching on again

SYSTEM.description: Position encoder communication or signal error detected.

resolution_steps: 4. Contact HEIDENHAIN service for encoder-specific issues

SYSTEM.description: Position deviation between commanded and actual position exceeds tolerance.

resolution_steps: 4. May need to adjust servo parameters
verification: 1. Test axis movement at low speed

DATA_MEDIA.description: Error detected in TNC file system or data media.

resolution_steps: 1. Use TNCremoNT to backup important files
2. Run file system repair if available
3. May need to restore files from backup
4. Contact HEIDENHAIN service if data unrecoverable

DATA_MEDIA.description: Error in TNC partition where NC programs and data are stored.

resolution_steps: 2. If programs lost: restore from backup
3. Contact machine manufacturer for recovery assistance

SERVO_DRIVE.description: The IPM (Intelligent Power Module) overheat detection functioned.
SERVO_DRIVE.source: Mitsubishi MELDAS MDS Series Alarm Manual USA-E99351

resolution_steps: 1. Clean drive heat sink and air filters

SERVO_DRIVE.description: A ground fault occurred in the motor.
SERVO_DRIVE.source: Mitsubishi MELDAS MDS Series Alarm Manual

diagnostic_steps: 3. Check for coolant or contamination in motor/cables
resolution_steps: 2. If motor insulation failed: replace motor
3. Clean and dry motor if contaminated

SERVO_DRIVE.safety_warning: Ground faults can cause electrical shock. Power off before inspection.

SERVO_DRIVE.description: The power was cut off for 50 msec or more.
SERVO_DRIVE.source: Mitsubishi MELDAS MDS Series Alarm Manual

resolution_steps: 1. If power unstable: check electrical installation
3. May need UPS for sensitive loads

SERVO_DRIVE.description: Regeneration resistor overheated alarm generated on power supply unit (Alarm K).
SERVO_DRIVE.source: Mitsubishi MELDAS 700 Series Alarm Parameter Manual

SERVO_DRIVE.description: Overvoltage alarm generated on power supply unit (Alarm L).
SERVO_DRIVE.source: Mitsubishi MELDAS 700 Series Alarm Parameter Manual

resolution_steps: 1. If input voltage high: check transformer taps
2. If regen issue: check regen resistor/circuit
3. Increase deceleration time to reduce regen

SERVO_DRIVE.alarm_name: Power Module or PC Board Overheat
SERVO_DRIVE.description: Power module or PC board overheated alarm generated on power supply unit (Alarm n).
SERVO_DRIVE.source: Mitsubishi MELDAS 700 Series Alarm Parameter Manual

PROGRAM.description: External mirror image or parameter mirror image commanded during facing turret mirror image.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check mirror image commands in program

PROGRAM.description: Synchronous control was started or canceled when it could not be started or canceled.

diagnostic_steps: 2. Verify machine state before sync command
resolution_steps: 1. Correct synchronous control sequence in program

PROGRAM.description: Constant surface speed (G96) issued without spindle speed clamp (G92/G50) under multiple spindle control.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for G92/G50 spindle clamp command
resolution_steps: 1. Add G92/G50 spindle clamp before G96

SYSTEM.description: System-level alarm requiring attention. May indicate hardware or software issue.

resolution_steps: 2. If alarm persists: may need parameter reload
3. Contact Mitsubishi service for Z-series alarms

SYSTEM.description: Error detected in EEPROM when high-gain mode and normal mode was selected.
SYSTEM.source: Mitsubishi MELDAS 700 Series Alarm Parameter Manual

diagnostic_steps: 2. Verify if alarm recurs after power cycle
resolution_steps: 2. If alarm persists: EEPROM error exists
3. Refer to MELDAS AC Servo Maintenance Manual

SYSTEM.description: Emergency button pressed or overtravel of axes detected.

immediate_actions: 1. Check if emergency stop button is pressed
resolution_steps: 2. If overtravel: jog axis away from limit

SYSTEM.alarm_name: Main Spindle Motor / Servo Unit Alarm
SYSTEM.description: Alarms of main spindle motor and servo unit detected.

immediate_actions: 1. Note alarm display on servo unit
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check alarm display on servo unit
verification: 1. Verify servo unit shows no alarm

SYSTEM.description: Abnormally large current flow detected in control power circuit.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check for short circuit in control power
resolution_steps: 3. Contact service if unable to locate cause

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Overcurrent can cause fire. Power off before inspection.

SYSTEM.description: Hydraulic pump motor overload detected.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check overload value on thermal relay
verification: 2. Verify thermal relay does not trip

SYSTEM.description: Hydraulic pressure is down below required level.
Spindle rotation is abnormal - speed deviation or feedback error.
Inverter fault detected on spindle or auxiliary drive.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check inverter display for specific fault
resolution_steps: 2. Check motor insulation if ground fault

SYSTEM.description: Emergency button pressed or overtravel of axes detected.

immediate_actions: 1. Check if emergency stop button is pressed
diagnostic_steps: 1. Release emergency stop button if pressed
resolution_steps: 2. If overtravel: manually jog axis away from limit
verification: 2. Verify all axes within travel limits

SYSTEM.description: Alarms of main spindle motor and servo unit detected.

immediate_actions: 1. Check alarm display on servo unit
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check servo unit LED display for specific alarm
2. Reference FANUC alarm codes (most Doosan use FANUC)
resolution_steps: 2. Power off and on after correction

SYSTEM.description: Abnormally large current flow detected in control power circuit.

immediate_actions: 2. Check for smoke or burning smell
diagnostic_steps: 1. Check control power circuit for short circuit
resolution_steps: 3. Verify power supply proper before restart

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Power off before inspecting electrical circuits.

SYSTEM.description: Hydraulic pump motor overload detected.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check overload value on thermal relay
3. Check hydraulic fluid level and condition
verification: 2. Verify thermal relay does not trip

SYSTEM.description: Hydraulic pressure is down.
Spindle rotation is abnormal - speed deviation or erratic operation.

resolution_steps: 1. If encoder issue: check connections, replace if faulty
2. If drive issue: check drive alarms
3. If mechanical: check bearings, belt tension

SYSTEM.description: Inverter fault detected - check inverter status.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check inverter display for specific fault

MORI_EX_ALARMS.description: Panel alarm - typically power supply related.
MORI_EX_ALARMS.source: Mori Seiki Technical Documentation / Field Experience

immediate_actions: 1. Check if control panel powers up
resolution_steps: 1. Replace faulty 24VDC power supply if found
verification: 2. Verify alarm clears after power cycle

MORI_EX_ALARMS.description: Programmed spindle RPM differs from actual RPM by excessive margin.
MORI_EX_ALARMS.source: Mori Seiki Technical Documentation / Practical Machinist

diagnostic_steps: 4. Review PMC parameters for allowable deviation
resolution_steps: 2. If drive faulty: check/replace servo drive
4. Check PMC ladder for parameter adjustment

MORI_EX_ALARMS.description: Motor interruption is abnormal - safety interlock or drive issue.

immediate_actions: 2. Note machine state when alarm occurred
resolution_steps: 1. If door switch issue: replace switch
2. If safety relay issue: replace faulty relay
3. If amplifier issue: have module tested/repaired

MORI_EX_ALARMS.description: Spindle switch control alarm - power supply or relay issue.

verification: 1. Verify power supplies output correct voltage

PROGRAM.description: Profile shape error in G71 or G72 cycle - Z-axis movement in wrong direction.
PROGRAM.source: DMG MORI Technical Support / FANUC Documentation

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check profile definition between P and Q blocks
resolution_steps: 1. Correct profile geometry to be monotonous
2. Ensure no Z+ moves during Z- roughing
3. Use I/K format for arcs to catch radius errors

PROGRAM.description: Absolute pulse coder position data lost - machine needs re-referencing.

immediate_actions: 1. Do not attempt to run program
resolution_steps: 1. Perform zero return (reference) for all affected axes
3. If battery low: replace encoder battery

PROGRAM.note: This alarm occurs when absolute encoder memory is lost. Re-referencing required.

PROGRAM.source: DMG MORI / Mori Seiki Service Documentation

resolution_steps: 3. If sensor issue: clean or replace sensor
4. Check hydraulic system if clamping issue

PROGRAM.description: Coolant tank level below minimum threshold.
Hydraulic system pressure below required level.
PROGRAM.source: DMG MORI / Mori Seiki Service Documentation

SYSTEM.description: General system alarm indicating control system error.

resolution_steps: 3. Contact HURCO Service at 800-638-1849 if unresolved

SYSTEM.description: Converter system error detected - power conversion issue.

diagnostic_steps: 2. Verify CNC and Field power supplies

SYSTEM.description: Servo position overrun detected - axis exceeded commanded position.

resolution_steps: 2. If encoder: check connections, replace if faulty

SYSTEM.description: Encoder phase A/C disconnection or pulse error detected.

ATC.description: Error from Duplomatic TMC turret controller unit.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Search alarm code in WinMax (Alarm Code dropdown)

SYSTEM.description: Overcurrent detected in drive system. Often power supply related.
SYSTEM.source: Brother Speedio Technical Documentation / Practical Machinist

diagnostic_steps: 4. Verify power phase balance (if using RPC)
resolution_steps: 1. If using rotary phase converter: consider digital phase converter
2. Check drive amplifier - replace if faulty
3. Check motor encoder - replace if needed

SYSTEM.description: Regenerative resistance alarm during spindle deceleration.
SYSTEM.source: Brother Speedio Technical Documentation / Practical Machinist

immediate_actions: 1. Note spindle speed when alarm occurred
resolution_steps: 2. If power unbalance: improve input power
verification: 1. Test spindle start/stop at various speeds

SYSTEM.description: Specified data exceeds address range or N-number limit exceeded.
SYSTEM.source: Brother Speedio Control Documentation / Practical Machinist

immediate_actions: 1. Note program location when alarm occurred
resolution_steps: 1. If N-number issue: reduce increment or disable N-numbers
2. If positioning issue: check 800 degree rotary limit

SYSTEM.description: Z-axis overtravel - often occurs when spindle is UP after loading new tool.
SYSTEM.source: Brother Speedio Control Documentation / Practical Machinist

diagnostic_steps: 1. In MANU MODE, check if spindle needs to be lowered
resolution_steps: 1. Use ATC button to lower spindle before Cycle Start
2. Verify tool in spindle is correct

SYSTEM.description: B-axis (rotary) servo alarm - often encoder mismatch or amplifier issue.

resolution_steps: 2. If A.C.C. error persists: may need amplifier replacement
3. Verify dip/rotary switch settings per documentation
verification: 1. Verify amplifier LED shows no error

SYSTEM.description: Error during tool change - tool not properly seated or key misaligned.
SYSTEM.source: Brother Speedio Technical Documentation / Practical Machinist

diagnostic_steps: 1. Verify tool key alignment with magazine holder
2. Check if tool properly seated in spindle
3. Look under tool to see drive slot alignment
resolution_steps: 1. Reinstall tool with proper key alignment

SYSTEM.safety_warning: Improper tool installation can cause tool ejection. Verify seating before running.

SYSTEM.description: Spindle failed to orient properly for tool change or C-axis operation.
Tapping cycle synchronization error - speed/feed mismatch.
SYSTEM.source: Brother Speedio Technical Documentation / Practical Machinist

diagnostic_steps: 1. Verify tap pitch matches programmed F
resolution_steps: 1. Correct feed/pitch relationship (F = S x pitch)
verification: 1. Test tap cycle in air first

SYSTEM.note: Tapping cycles on Speedio are very fast - verify tool/depth setup carefully.

PROGRAM.description: No feedrate (F) has been programmed for interpolated move.

immediate_actions: 1. Check program for missing F command
diagnostic_steps: 1. Verify F command before interpolated moves
resolution_steps: 1. Add F command before linear/circular interpolation
2. Verify F value is reasonable for operation

PROGRAM.description: Subroutine nesting level exceeded maximum allowed.
Tool radius compensation not properly activated or cancelled.

diagnostic_steps: 2. Check compensation cancelled before tool change
resolution_steps: 1. Add proper G41/G42 before cutting moves
2. Add G40 before tool changes or program end

SYSTEM.description: External emergency stop is active - PLC message error.

diagnostic_steps: 3. Check wiring to X9 connector pin 37 (+24V)
verification: 2. Test all E-stop buttons and limits

SYSTEM.description: Axis has exceeded travel limits.

immediate_actions: 1. Note which axis is in overtravel
resolution_steps: 1. Jog axis away from limit in opposite direction

SYSTEM.description: Servo drive error detected - check drive status.

diagnostic_steps: 1. Check servo drive LED/display for specific fault

SYSTEM.description: PLC error detected - check PLC message.

resolution_steps: 3. Contact machine builder for PLC-specific issues
